entry.title: Re: Clarification on Location and Plant Section in SAP
entry.content:
Hi SMEs;

In SAP Plant Maintenance (PM), both Location and Plant Section are organizational fields used for reporting, analysis, and structuring equipment and functional locations.

However, they serve different purposes:

Purpose of the Fields:

Location: Represents the physical place where the equipment or functional location is installed (e.g., Building A, Workshop 3, Line 2). It is mainly used for technical reporting, analysis of failures by location, and geographic/physical grouping.

Plant Section: Represents the responsible organizational unit within the plant (e.g., Mechanical Team, Electrical Section, Production Unit). It is mainly used for assigning responsibility, work planning, and accountability of maintenance activities.

Key Differences: Location ‚Üí "Where" the equipment is installed (physical/geographic).

Plant Section ‚Üí "Who" is responsible for the equipment (organizational responsibility).

Criteria for Definition: Define Location based on physical hierarchy: building, line, workshop, area.

Define Plant Section based on responsibility: maintenance section, production department, or unit responsible for operations.

Recommended Steps for Unification: Assessment: Review current master data usage in both fields across plants.

Harmonization Rules: Define clear rules: "Location = physical place" / "Plant Section = responsible org unit".

Data Cleansing: Clean up duplicate or inconsistent entries. Governance: Establish governance rules so that master data creation follows the unified logic.

Testing: Validate with reporting and maintenance order assignments to ensure the logic works. Rollout: Apply changes systematically across all plants.

In summary: Location is ‚Äúwhere‚Äù, Plant Section is ‚Äúwho‚Äù. Unification should not mean merging them into one field, but rather defining clear usage rules and cleaning data so both fields are consistent and meaningful.

entry.title: Parent/Child Vendor Relationships (Hierarchy) in Ariba
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently exploring an enhancement for one of our clients involving Parent/Child Vendor Relationships in SAP Ariba, and we would appreciate your insights or guidance on how best to approach this.

Current Setup:

  • Vendor records are created and maintained in S/4HANA via MDG, and synchronized with SAP Ariba twice daily.
  • In Ariba, each vendor is created as a standalone entry, resulting in multiple listings for the same company (e.g., Microsoft, U.S. Bank, Amazon), often representing different business units or geographies.
  • This leads to confusion during vendor selection, as users must manually identify the correct vendor from a long list.

Business Requirement:

  • Display only a single vendor option (parent) during selection in Ariba Buying.
  • Enable spend reporting to be consolidated across all associated child vendors.

Request for Guidance:

  • Is there a native capability in Ariba to support parent/child vendor relationships?
  • If not, are there any recommended configurations, workarounds, or best practices to achieve this?
  • Has anyone implemented a similar solution or enhancement?

Any documentation, experience, or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support!
SAP Ariba Spend Analysis SAP Ariba Invoice Management , SAP Ariba Sourcing SAP Ariba Supplier Risk SAP Ariba Buying and Invoicing SAP Supplier Lifecycle Management

entry.title: Re: Wear Monitoring Measurement Maintenance Plans/Counters
entry.content:
Hi  Kaejae;
Of course, the explanation I have given below is brief and very concise. In this regard, SAP has left the consultants' hands very full in terms of measurement points.

In SAP PM, the behavior you are facing is standard for counter-based maintenance plans. By default, the system schedules the next call based on multiples of the cycle (180, 360, 540, etc.) unless you reset the plan.

To achieve your requirement ‚Äî triggering every time the counter reaches 180 units regardless of when the last change-out occurred ‚Äî you have two main options:

1-Use a Performance-Based Maintenance Plan with Reset Counter Technique (Measuring Point Reset):

Instead of letting the counter accumulate indefinitely, use the ‚ÄúReset Counter‚Äù function when the equipment is replaced.

This way, the maintenance plan always starts counting from zero again, and the next due will always be at 180.

Important: you must configure the measuring point as "Counter with Reset" (not cumulative total).

2-Alternative: Use a Condition-Based Strategy Plan with Measurement Documents:

Instead of relying purely on counters, define a single-cycle strategy plan linked to the wear measuring point.

In this case, the plan evaluates the latest measurement documents, and as soon as the threshold (180) is crossed, a work order will be generated.

This avoids misalignment when the actual change-out happens later (e.g., at 195 or 225).

Recommendation:
The cleanest approach is to use Reset Counter at each change-out. That way, your cycle is always 0 ‚Üí 180, independent of the previous readings. If you cannot reset the counter, then condition-based maintenance with measurement documents and threshold values is the better option.

 

Step 1: Create Measuring Point (Wear Counter)

TCode: `IK01` (Create Measuring Point)
SPRO Path:
`Plant Maintenance and Customer Service ‚Üí Master Data in Plant Maintenance and Customer Service ‚Üí Technical Objects ‚Üí Measuring Points and Counters ‚Üí Create Measuring Point`

Key Settings:

Assign Measuring Point to Equipment or Functional Location.
Measuring Point Category ‚Üí Counter (with reset option) .
Define Unit of Measurement (e.g., mm, hr, cycle).
Activate Reset Counter Allowed to enable reset after each change out.

my Scenario

Step 2: Create Maintenance Item

TCode: `IP41` (Create Maintenance Item)
SPRO Path:
`Plant Maintenance and Customer Service ‚Üí Maintenance and Service Processing ‚Üí Maintenance Plans, Work Scheduling ‚Üí Maintenance and Service Items ‚Üí Create Maintenance Item`

Key Settings:

Link the Equipment and Measuring Point.
Define Cycle = 180 (e.g., 180 mm, 180 hours, etc.).

 

Step 3: Create Counter Based Maintenance Plan

TCode: `IP42` (Create Maintenance Plan)
SPRO Path:
`Plant Maintenance and Customer Service ‚Üí Maintenance and Service Processing ‚Üí Maintenance Plans, Work Scheduling ‚Üí Maintenance Plans ‚Üí Create Single Cycle Plan`

Key Settings:

Choose Counter Based Strategy .
Assign the Maintenance Item created in Step 2.
Cycle Length = 180.
Scheduling Indicator = Performance Based .

 

Step 4: Reset Counter During Change Out

TCode: `IK11` (Create Measurement Document)
When the part/equipment is changed, create a Measurement Document and reset the counter.
The counter will restart from zero ‚Üí next trigger will again be at 180.

 

Step 5: Testing the Scenario

1. Daily Reading Entry (Measurement Document):

`IK11` ‚Üí enter values (e.g., 170 ‚Üí 175 ‚Üí 180).
At ‚â•180, system generates a Maintenance Call .

2. Generate Maintenance Order:

After reaching 180, system automatically creates a PM Order.
Use `IP10` to schedule and process the plan.

3. After Change Out:

Record reset in WO completion (via IK11).
Counter starts at zero ‚Üí next WO triggers at 180 again.

Alternative: Condition Based Maintenance

If you don‚Äôt want to reset counters and only want to trigger whenever the reading exceeds 180:

SPRO Path:
`Plant Maintenance and Customer Service ‚Üí Maintenance and Service Processing ‚Üí Maintenance Plans, Work Scheduling ‚Üí Condition Based Maintenance ‚Üí Define Threshold Values`
Define Threshold = 180.
System will trigger WO whenever the reading ‚â•180 (no reset needed).

Outcome:

Option 1 (Counter with Reset): Clean cycle ‚Üí every 180 the system triggers a WO.
Option 2 (Condition Based): WO triggered each time the measurement exceeds the defined threshold (180), even without resetting.

entry.title: Manual Leave Collection for Employees/ Converting AL balance to a custom Overseas Leave Quota
entry.content:
Namaste Everyone,
In this blog we shall understand a challenge we faced in Time Off ‚Äì

Manual Leave Collection for Employees/ Converting Annual Leave balance to a custom Overseas Leave Quota

Problem Statement:

  • Employees‚Äô Annual Leave balance for the current year will be converted to a Leave Quota called Overseas Leave Quota should they wish to have it and are approved to do so by 31 December. Employees will be able to select to convert a fraction / full Annual Leaves to Overseas Leave during the month of December.
  • The selected number will be deducted from Annual Leave balance and shall be used by an employee in the upcoming year.

Example: Overseas leave collected from Annual Leaves in Dec 2025 can be utilized by an employee in entire year of 2026. 

Problem Transformation in SAP/SF Consulting Terms:

Currently, we do not have a pre-built mechanism to create manual entries for Leave Quotas to be exchanged-Annual Leave Quota to Any Quota for example an Overseas Leave Quota. 

Prerequisites:

One should know how Time Accounts are created, Calendars, etc are run & where one places an Interim Update rule.

Solution Proposed:

We introduced:

  • Custom MDF portlet for employees to enter the quantity of leaves they wish to transform into Overseas Quota Leaves from Annual Leave Balance.
  • We shall run interim updates on Annual Leave Balance Quotas and then on Overseas Leave Quota to convert the quantity of leaves.
  • We will create a custom field in Time Account called: ‚ÄúBALANCE AT ACCOUNT CLOSING FOR OVERSEAS LEAVE ‚Äú‚Äì which shall store the leave balance which we placed in MDF into Annual Leave Quota Time Account, let‚Äôs call it via INTERIM UPDATE ‚Äì A run.
  • This BALANCE shall be carried forward to Overseas Leave Quota with another job called ‚Äì INTERIM UPDATE ‚Äì B run.
  • We can see this Balance in our Time Accounts for Overseas Leave Quotas and on next year‚Äôs Absences screen.

Flowchart:

Employee enters leave quantity 

in Custom MDF Portlet 

(Annual Leave ‚Üí Overseas Quota Leave)

         ‚Üì

 Interim Update ‚Äì A run

Updates Annual Leave Balance Quota

and transfers to

         ‚Üì

 BALANCE AT ACCOUNT CLOSING FOR OVERSEAS LEAVE

(custom field in Time Account)

         ‚Üì

 Interim Update ‚Äì B run

Transfers BALANCE to Overseas Leave Quota

         ‚Üì

 Final BALANCE visible in

Time Accounts (Overseas Leave Quota)

& also, in Next Year‚Äôs Absence Screen

 

Technical Build:

  1. We have created a simple effective dated MDF to capture quantity of leaves that an employee wishes to be deducted from Annual leaves balances to be stored in Overseas Leave Quota for the next year.

                We shall give the required details here.

 

  1. While we toggle to Annual Leave Quota, we can see the number of initial Annual Leaves.

 

  1. We shall, now, run an ‚ÄúInterim Update ‚Äì A‚Äù to fetch the value put in MDF to be placed in a custom field ‚ÄúBALANCE AT ACCOUNT CLOSING FOR OVERSEAS LEAVE ‚Äúin Time Account for Annual Leave Quota.

 

  Interim Update rule ‚Äì A (Placed in Interim Update Section of Annual Leave Quota Time Account) can be seen as below:

 

 

  1. We must send this Balance to Overseas Leave Quota now.

We shall run Interim Update - B (Placed in Interim Update section of Overseas Leave Time Account)

 

 

  1. Upon running Interim Update -2 , we can see that the Annual leave balance has been reduced by 12.

 

Simultaneously, Overseas Leave Quota has added 12 days in it for next year 2026

 

  1. We can, now, toggle to Absence page and claim our leaves for the next year and check if they are coming up.

 In the manner above, we were able to provide solution to this challenging problem by use of a mixed bag of Interim rules and a lot of Consulting know-how. 

Hope you find it helpful!

Thanks,

Rahul VijayKiran Mattoo

entry.title: Re: what is the meaning of packaging material type when m...
entry.content:
Hello @maggie2 

The packaging material type in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition groups packaging materials and controls handling-unit (HU) behaviour, for example, number assignment rules, closed/open handling, and label printing SAP Help-Supply Chain Packaging Material

How to read your list

Car = Carton, Pal = Pallet, WB = Wood box/wire basket (generic box/basket), Auxiliary Pack Mat = slip-sheets, fillers, lids, etc. SAP Help Portal-SAP Extended Warehouse Management (SAP EWM)

Int./Ext. = number assignment allows internal and/or external HU numbers

SSCC (Serial Shipping Container Code) is supported for HU identification in Cloud SAP Help-Handling Unit Identification

Auxiliary packaging materials such as lids, fillers, and slip-sheets are part of the Cloud packing model. SAP Help Portal-Packing

Your codes, decoded

SP11 ‚Äì Carton, internal/external numbering, closed

SP12 ‚Äì Carton, external numbering, closed

SP13 ‚Äì Carton, SSCC numbering, closed

SP14 ‚Äì Carton, GTL numbering, closed

SP21 ‚Äì Pallet, internal/external, open

SP22 ‚Äì Pallet, external, open

SP23 ‚Äì Pallet, SSCC, open

SP24 ‚Äì Pallet, GTL, open

SP31 ‚Äì Box/Basket, internal/external, closed

SP32 ‚Äì Box/Basket, external, closed

SP33 ‚Äì Box/Basket, SSCC, closed

SP34 ‚Äì Box/Basket, GTL, closed

SP41 ‚Äì Auxiliary packaging material (filler, lid, slip sheet, and others)

Practical tip for the migration template (Product)

Map packaging materials material type VERP/LEIH to the appropriate SP type by considering the container form (carton, pallet, or box), the numbering scheme (internal, external, SSCC, GTL), and whether it needs to be closed or open.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

For photos or labels later, SSCC/GTL types allow you to print compliant IDs on HU labels.

entry.title: Redraw mdk page SAP Service Asset Manager after filter
entry.content:
Hello experts.

I have the same problem that most of users here have but I cant figure it out.

SAP Service Asset Manager 2405 is integrated with NFC reading.  The task is to filter operation list on 

WorkOrderOperationsListViewPage when scan NFC tag that it assigned to FLOC that is filled in Operation.
I did all the integration and logic for searching FLOCs and operations depending on NFC tag but after scan the tag the operation list is not updated/redrawed. 
If I go back and then return to this screen again then screen is redrawed and operation list is updated correctly(so I assume that the logic I have done for filter the list works correctly)
 
 My logic is based on filter the operation list. After scanning NFC tag I call 
 
await SaveFilterAsDefault(context);
 
 to apply filters.  Inside this function I have added the return filterresults for my page where the list of operations is showed
 
 case 'WorkOrderOperationsListViewPage':
            filterResults = await GetNFCFilter(context);
            break;
 
The difference between classic filter is that I dont open new filter page to choose values. I am trying to do it on one screen. Thats why I added new case page.
As I do the async search for filterResults I do await for returning data. Only after that this is executed
 
await FilterSettings.onSettingsSave(context, filterResults);
 
As I mentioned before I am sure that filterResults work correctly because if I reopen page the data is filtered.
In debuge console I see 
 
mdk.trace.odata: read succeeded Params: {"entitySet":"MyWorkOrderHeaders('4000047')/Operations","queryOptions":"$orderby=OperationNo&$top=50&$filter=(OperationFunctionLocation%20eq%20'1201-EXT-BMR-B01-001')"}
 
After applying filters I tried to do
 
let table = context.getPageProxy().getControl("SectionedTable");
table.redraw();
let section = context.getPageProxy().getControl("SectionedTable").getSection("WorkOrderOperationListSection");
section.redraw();
     
  But it doesnt redraw the table.

Only this helped to update the NFC tag after scan in object header of this page. but not the table.

 

context.getPageProxy().setActionBinding(context.binding);
context.getPageProxy().redraw();
 

Can anyone help with this? 

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Re: Clarification on Location and Plant Section in SAP
entry.content:
hello ;
Thank you for your expert and interesting discussion. Your seriousness and follow-up speak volumes about your expertise.
In SAP S/4HANA, the usage of Location, Plant Section, and Work Center within functional location master data can be differentiated as follows:

Work Center: Indicates the organizational unit responsible for performing the work (e.g., maintenance department, production team). It is linked to capacity planning, scheduling, and cost allocation.

Location: Refers to the physical location of the technical object (e.g., building, area, shop floor). It is primarily used for reporting, filtering, and structuring technical objects by their physical placement.

Plant Section: This field is intended to represent a subdivision within the plant, typically used to indicate organizational responsibility for a specific area of operations or equipment within the plant (e.g., mechanical section, utilities, or packaging area).

Unlike the Work Center, which is used in work execution, Plant Section is more for classification and responsibility mapping in master data.

In practice:

Use Work Center for operational responsibility (who performs the work).

Use Plant Section for organizational responsibility within the plant (which section of the plant owns or oversees the equipment).

Use Location for the physical/geographical placement of the equipment.

Regarding global references:

SAP generally follows ISO 14224 (Petroleum, petrochemical and natural gas industries ‚Äì Collection and exchange of reliability and maintenance data for equipment) where organizational responsibility and location are distinguished.

Internal company guidelines or RACI responsibility matrices are often mapped to these fields.

Best practice: Clearly define in your company maintenance policy how each field should be used, to ensure consistency across plants.

entry.title: Re: CAP - Use i18n for Error Messages
entry.content:
Hi @hoandreasm,

Great, that‚Äôs an improvement!
Could you please check the Network tab in your browser‚Äôs developer console to see whether the browser is trying to load the .properties files in the browser‚Äôs language?

A few months ago, I created a small CAP (Node.js) project to explore some capabilities. In that project, I implemented translations for all app texts, including error messages from the service handlers. You can take a look at it, it might help you troubleshoot the issue: GitHub project.
I tested it this morning with my browser set to English: after cloning the repo, running npm install, and starting the app with cds watch, everything loaded in English as expected.
To simulate an error, you can select a "CANCELLED" flight and add a delay to it.
Then, I switched my browser language to French, restarted it, relaunched the app and all texts appeared in French.

I hope this helps you identify where your issue might be coming from!

Best regards,
Valentin

entry.title: DELINS IDoc: How can system accept different time daily schedule line
entry.content:
We receive inbound DELINS IDoc and for one location, it wants to accept time specific daily schedule lines for SDSA.  Currently, the logic in IDOC_INPUT_DELINS overwrites the existing daily schedule line if the incoming IDoc has the same date even if the time and quantity is different.  In manual VA32 transaction, it allows multiple daily schedule line for the same date and different time.  But not for the inbound IDoc. 

For example, if the SDSA has existing daily schedule line 19.09.2025 time 04:00 with quantity 300 ST, and then IDoc segment field E1EDP16-EDATUV 19.09.2025, E1EDP16-EZEIT 16:00 with quantity E1EDP16-WMENG 150 ST.  The SDSA schedule line will be updated to 19.09.2025 16:00 150 ST.  Our expectation is the SDSA should have 2 daily lines for the date 19.09.2025.

I'm not sure if this is a bug but in case, is there a note on this?  Or can this be solved by customizing or a user-exit/enhancement needs to be implemented in function module IDOC_INPUT_DELINS?

There is one requirement that, while creating a Business partner (Supplier), when the user is entering the value in the TAX number field, it should trigger an error or warning that if the TAX number is wrong based on the State code or address.{Eg-While creating a supplier with region Karnataka, the tax code must be 29ABCDE1234F1Z0 for IN3, but if you choose another tax number 33ABCDE1234F1Z0 (tax number of Tamil Nadu) for IN3, it is picking up. It should throw an error.}

Can this feasibility be achieved, or any standard way to set this up?

Regards,

Swaroop Nayak

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement MM (Materials Management)

entry.title: Re: Clarification on Location and Plant Section in SAP
entry.content: hello ; Thank you for your expert and interesting discussion. Your seriousness and follow-up speak volumes about your expertise. In SAP S/4HANA, the usage of Location, Plant Section, and Work Center within functional location master data can be differentiated as follows: Work Center: Indicates the organizational unit responsible for performing the work (e.g., maintenance department, production team). It is linked to capacity planning, scheduling, and cost allocation. Location: Refers to the physical location of the technical object (e.g., building, area, shop floor). It is primarily used for reporting, filtering, and structuring technical objects by their physical placement. Plant Section: This field is intended to represent a subdivision within the plant, typically used to indicate organizational responsibility for a specific area of operations or equipment within the plant (e.g., mechanical section, utilities, or packaging area). Unlike the Work Center, which is used in work execution, Plant Section is more for classification and responsibility mapping in master data. In practice: Use Work Center for operational responsibility (who performs the work). Use Plant Section for organizational responsibility within the plant (which section of the plant owns or oversees the equipment). Use Location for the physical/geographical placement of the equipment. Regarding global references: SAP generally follows ISO 14224 (Petroleum, petrochemical and natural gas industries ‚Äì Collection and exchange of reliability and maintenance data for equipment) where organizational responsibility and location are distinguished. Internal company guidelines or RACI responsibility matrices are often mapped to these fields. Best practice: Clearly define in your company maintenance policy how each field should be used, to ensure consistency across plants.

entry.title: Minimizing SAP License Costs by optimizing SAP Authorizations with MOON Services
entry.content:
‚ÄúMOON ‚Äì Minimize Overhead, Optimize Need‚Äù

Efficient authorization management is crucial within the SAP environment for optimizing license costs. MOON Services aim to reduce authorizations to their necessary minimum, ensuring that what SAP users utilize is licensed, while optimizing unused authorizations. Let's explore the three essential MOON services: "MOON License Simulation", "MOON License Quickfix" and "MOON License Service powered by AIRC", each designed to enhance license management.

MOON License Simulation

MOON License Simulation focuses on precisely defining user license types in the SAP S/4HANA system through tailored authorizations to their essential minimum. This service enables companies to manage licenses efficiently and significantly reduce unnecessary costs.

Through simulation, customers can identify potential license cost optimizations when engaging in an authorization redesign with SAP Consulting. The service includes downloading usage data and calculating license costs for a new S/4HANA authorization concept against the requirements of the current STAR Service framework. Customers gain insight into possible license cost optimizations that can be achieved after an authorization redesign.


MOON License Quickfix

The MOON License Quickfix service offers rapid modifications to existing authorization structures, ensuring efficiency in license categorization. By analyzing current authorizations and making immediate role adjustments, companies can implement instant cost-saving measures.

This service focuses on reducing effort by minimizing authorization values and adapting authorization objects. By achieving quick wins in license type optimization, companies can significantly save costs while maintaining operational efficiency.


MOON License Service powered by AIRC

MOON License Service powered by AIRC (Automated Implementation of Role Concept) elevates license cost minimization to a new level, employing advanced automation and SAP Best Practices to refine authorizations. This service is designed to decrease effort and duration in managing roles and authorizations, enabling seamless cost management.

Driven by SAP AI Core automation, MOON AIRC precisely tailors authorizations to the necessary minimum, achieving substantial cost reductions and enhanced security. The service includes scoping, functional and organizational role definitions, and strategic role assignments‚Äîall aimed at minimizing license costs. Synchronization capabilities from SAP Signavio ensure a coherent approach to authorization management. In addition to optimizing license costs, this service delivers a high-quality, secure SAP Best Practice authorization concept.


Conclusion

The MOON services are at the forefront of license cost optimization, enabling companies to efficiently reduce authorizations to their necessary minimum. By focusing on precise authorization adjustments and employing automation, MOON Services empower organizations to achieve operational efficiency and substantial cost savings. Harness the potential of MOON Services and navigate your path to optimized license management and reduced overhead.

For more information about the offering send a mail to: security.consulting@sap.com

The option to search for and download SNotes in SAPforMe directly from transaction SNote is also not possible because of the internet issue.
 
Is there a workaround for this type of situation. Maybe downloading multiple SNotes from SAPforMe in batch and copy the downloaded SNotes to filesystem, then upload to SNote?
 
Many Thanks

entry.title: Re: How to add entries to transports to delete objects which were deleted in Dev and not in TADIR?
entry.content: Hi @woutdejong. This happens when you delete an developmentobject, for example a ddic table, by transaction and write it directly to a transport request. The object is added to the request and when it is exported, then there is a check if the object still persists. if not it makes a delete entry on the request. BUT: This does not work if you deleted an developmentobject that way and later you want to create a transportrequest containing the deleted object. The SAP Functionmodule also exists with error "TADIR-Entry not found" when trying to add the deleted object with objfunc=' '.

entry.title: Re: Currency USD provided is incorrect for Product MCOBL-...
entry.content:
Good day @maggie2 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

I recommend you consult Product,  Master Data Consistency & Currencies for more details.

The error you are facing means that the currency you entered in the migration template does not match the local currency of the company code assigned to the valuation area 0003. In public cloud, the valuation currency is derived from the company code configuration and cannot be overridden in migration. Please check which company code is assigned to valuation area 0003 and use that company‚Äôs local currency in your valuation data sheet. Once you have aligned it, the error will no longer appear during simulation.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Im BW mit Routine Hashtag erstetzen
entry.content:
Hi Johannes,

# is most likely representing a non-printable character. That's why replacing '#' does not work as expected.

You can try replacing non-printable characters with a regular expression like this:

REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[^[:print:]]' IN lv_text WITH ''.

Note that you may have to adapt the solution proposal above according to your business requirements.

Regards,
Dominik

entry.title: Re: Duplicate Materials issue in large based companies
entry.content:
Hello @BANDLAVENKATESH 

I think it is perfectly fine to have multiple materials with the same controlling / technical fields as long as they model different products. In my opinion, a material qualifies as a duplicate if it redundantly models a product that is already modelled with another material. I do understand the vagueness of this statement - it really depends on your specific environment if a material is a legitimate duplicate or not. That is why large organizations use tools like SAP MDG do manage master data.

Marking a duplicate material with LVORM is not enough in my mind. You would also need to transfer existing stock from a duplicate to a legitimate material, also consider open documents of the duplicate. 

Bear in mind that marking a material for deletion (LVORM = X) doesn't not prevent its usage in general, e.g. the note 2821773 - Sales order can be created with a material marked for deletion 

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Revenue recognition key EPMFC EPPM (Project Managemen...
entry.content:
Good day @summy 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

I recommend you consult Cost-Based Percentage of Completion,  Event-Based Revenue Recognition & Revenue and Cost Accounting for more details.

To summarise, when you use the cost-based revenue recognition key EPMFC in public cloud, the system caps the percentage at 100%, even if your actual costs exceed planned costs. The cost overrun will not trigger additional revenue recognition beyond the planned revenue. This is designed to align with IFRS 15 and GAAP, thereby ensuring that recognised revenue cannot exceed the contractual revenue. Therefore, in your example, when your planned cost = 500 and actual cost = 1,000, the recognised revenue remains 1,000 which is your defined 100% and not 2,000 which will equal 200%.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Hi Neil,

no, there are no restrictions with regards to the number of services that you can publish.

On which of the shared instances of the SAP BTP ABAP Trial Environement that are currently running are  you working?

We recently encountered problems on the following two US instances:

https://7ab63f61-d9c7-4bcf-9057-beead39881c1.abap.us10.hana.ondemand.com 

https://f3cc5dd0-460a-4857-8feb-b1d471dd9dbc.abap.us10.hana.ondemand.com 

If this is the case you should delete and recreate your ABAP environment instance in your SAP BTP Trial account as described in my following blog post:

How to delete and re-create your ABAP environment ... - SAP Community

Please note, that you will get a user on a new instance. So in case you want to "rescue" any content that you had developed you should move it to a Git repository. How to do this is described in that blog post as well.

How to check which instance you are on:

You can check the URL of the SAP BTP ABAP Trial instance you are working on by right clicking on your ADT project and choosing Properties from the contect menue.

So in my case I named the project TRL_US_2507_B (since I have several of them ;-))

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere Space Organization Strategy and Outlook with SAP Business Data Cloud

Hello,

Thank you for this article, which aptly summarizes the strategic thinking we are currently engaged in. Your proposals resonate with the architectures we have deployed and those we envision for the future.

Here is a summary of our experience and vision.

1. Tenant Strategy

Regarding tenant strategy, our experience with our clients has led us, primarily for cost management reasons, to favor architectures based on one or two tenants. A three-tenant approach is not currently recommended in our project contexts.

2. Current Space Architecture

Our current structure is designed to ensure strong governance while offering flexibility to the business teams. It is structured as follows:

  • A/ Administration and Connections Space: Strictly reserved for IT, this space centralizes the management of connections to source systems.

  • B/ Analytical Model Development Space: Also managed by IT, this space is dedicated to the development and certification of central analytical models (the "core model").

  • C/ Authorization Tables Management Space: A dedicated space that ensures centralized and secure governance of data access.

  • D/ Dedicated Business Spaces: For each line of business, we provision a space where copies of the models from space (B) are exposed. This approach allows Power Users:

    • To evolve their own models autonomously, without impacting the original certified models.

    • To test specific use cases. If a need proves relevant and recurring, it can then be industrialized by IT for integration into the central model.

This model empowers the business teams with control over reporting, thus fulfilling the promise of agility initially conveyed by the Business Layer concept.

Security Consideration: A key feature of our architecture is data segregation. The technical spaces (A and B) are systematically duplicated to isolate HR data and sources from non-HR data, thereby guaranteeing the confidentiality of sensitive information, even from the development teams.

3. Evolution Perspective towards SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)

The evolution of SAP Datasphere towards SAP BDC encourages us to consider an architecture aligned with the platform's best practices, structured in layers:

  • A/ Acquisition Space: Centralization of all raw data (local tables, remote views) and replication flows.

  • B/ Modeling Space: Development of all transformation logic and the semantic layer (SQL views, graphical views) necessary for building the final models.

  • C/ Reporting Space: Exposure of the final analytical models, constituting the single source of truth for consumption in SAP Analytics Cloud.

This architecture is similar to your latest proposal. However, in our concept, we would maintain the principle of autonomous business spaces downstream. These spaces would consume the models from the reporting space (C) but would still allow business teams to create and adapt copies, thereby preserving their agility in creating and modifying their own analytical models.

This hybrid approach would allow us to combine robust, centralized data governance with the essential autonomy for end-users.

Best regards, Patrice Mathieu

entry.title: Re: How to grey out the Delete button in VA02Ôºü
entry.content:
Hello @WUYIN 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

In public cloud, you cannot directly modify GUI screens or grey out buttons when you use exits or screen variants. However, there are some supported ways to enable you control the delete action.

Option 1 is to: Use the Maintain Business Roles app. Open your user role √† go to General Restrictions √† Business Catalogs √† and remove access to the Delete Sales Order action. This automatically hides or disables the Delete button for that role.

Option 2 is to Adapt UI for your Fiori Apps. In the Manage Sales Orders or Change Sales Orders app, open Adapt UI, hide the Delete button, and publish the change for the relevant business role.

Option 3 requires a BAdI (Custom Logic). For you to technically safeguard the function, use the Custom Logic app and implement BAdI SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM OR SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEADER to block deleteion attempt

I recommend you consult Key User Extensibility on SAP S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äì Adding Custom Business Logic,  Extensibility & Maintain Business Roles for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP MDG : Accessing Change Request Data by Business Activity & Change Request Type
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

Create one custom class, with 02 methods:

ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE

GET_INSTANCE_GOV_API

* <SIGNATURE>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | Static Public Method ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE=>GET_INSTANCE_GOV_API
* +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | [--->] IV_MODEL                       TYPE        USMD_MODEL
* | [<---] EV_INSTANCE_EXISTS             TYPE        ABAP_BOOL
* | [<---] EO_GOV_API                     TYPE REF TO CL_USMD_GOV_API
* +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</SIGNATURE>
  METHOD get_instance_gov_api.
    DATA: lo_gov_api   TYPE REF TO if_usmd_gov_api,
          lo_cx_root   TYPE REF TO cx_root,
          lv_exception TYPE        string.
    IF cl_usmd_gov_api=>check_instance_exists( iv_model_name = iv_model ) EQ abap_false.
      ev_instance_exists = abap_false.
      TRY.
          cl_usmd_gov_api=>get_instance(
            EXPORTING
              iv_model_name = iv_model
            RECEIVING
              ro_gov_api    = lo_gov_api
          ).
        CATCH cx_usmd_gov_api INTO lo_cx_root.
          lv_exception = lo_cx_root->get_text( ).
      ENDTRY.
      IF lv_exception IS INITIAL AND
         lo_gov_api   IS BOUND.
        eo_gov_api ?= lo_gov_api.
      ENDIF.
    ELSE.
      ev_instance_exists = abap_true.
      TRY.
          cl_usmd_gov_api=>get_instance(
            EXPORTING
              iv_model_name = iv_model
            RECEIVING
              ro_gov_api    = lo_gov_api
          ).
        CATCH cx_usmd_gov_api INTO lo_cx_root.
          lv_exception = lo_cx_root->get_text( ).
      ENDTRY.
      IF lv_exception IS INITIAL AND
         lo_gov_api   IS BOUND.
        eo_gov_api ?= lo_gov_api.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

GET_CR_DATA 
(***Note: above method making use in this method)

* <SIGNATURE>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | Static Public Method ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE=>GET_CR_DATA
* +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | [--->] IV_CR_ID                       TYPE        USMD_CREQUEST
* | [<-->] CS_CR_ATTRIBUTES               TYPE        USMD_S_CREQUEST(optional)
* | [<-->] CV_MODEL                       TYPE        USMD_MODEL(optional)
* | [<-->] CV_CR_TYPE_PROCESS             TYPE        USMD_PROCESS(optional)
* | [<-()] RT_CR_DATA                     TYPE        USMD_TS_ENTITY_DATA_ALL
* +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</SIGNATURE>
    METHOD get_cr_data.
    DATA: lo_gov_api     TYPE REF TO  cl_usmd_gov_api,
          lt_cr_data     TYPE         usmd_ts_entity_data_all,
          lv_model       TYPE         usmd_model,
          lv_inst_exists TYPE         abap_bool.
    " Determine the  model from CR ID to get the instance of
    " Goverance API.
    CHECK IV_CR_ID IS NOT INITIAL.
    IF NOT cv_model IS INITIAL.
      lv_model = cv_model.
    ELSE.
      cl_usmd_crequest_util=>get_model_by_cr(
        EXPORTING
          i_crequest = iv_cr_id
        IMPORTING
          e_model    = cv_model
      ).
    ENDIF.
    " Get the instance of the governance API
    IF NOT cv_model IS INITIAL.
      ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE=>get_instance_gov_api(
        EXPORTING
          iv_model           = cv_model
        IMPORTING
          ev_instance_exists = lv_inst_exists
          eo_gov_api         = lo_gov_api
      ).
      " Read the data of the CR data using the Governance API
      IF lo_gov_api IS BOUND.
        lo_gov_api->if_usmd_gov_api_cr_data~get_crequest_data(
          EXPORTING
            iv_crequest_id          = iv_cr_id
          IMPORTING
            et_entity_data_inactive = rt_cr_data
        ).
        " CR Header Data
        cs_cr_attributes = lo_gov_api->if_usmd_gov_api_cr_data~get_crequest_attributes( iv_crequest_id = iv_cr_id  ).
        " CR Business activity or Business Process ID
        SELECT SINGLE usmd_process
                 FROM usmd1601
                 INTO _cr_type_process
                WHERE usmd_creq_type = _cr_attributes-usmd_creq_type.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

Now, Making use of ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE in system method caller implementation (if_usmd_ssw_syst_method_caller~call_system_method)

DATA: 
ls_crequest     TYPE usmd_s_crequest,
lv_model        TYPE usmd_model,
lv_cr_process   TYPE usmd_process,
lt_cr_data      TYPE usmd_ts_entity_data_all,
lt_supp_data  TYPE REF TO data.

FIELD-SYMBOLS:
<lt_supp_data> TYPE SORTED TABLE,
<ls_supp_data> TYPE any,
<lv_fno> TYPE any.

CALL METHOD zcl_mdgs_assistive=>get_cr_data
      EXPORTING
        iv_cr_id           = iv_cr_number
      CHANGING
        cs_cr_attributes   = ls_crequest
        cv_model           = lv_model
        cv_cr_type_process = lv_cr_process
      RECEIVING
        rt_cr_data         = lt_cr_data.

IF ls_crequest-usmd_creq_type = 'ZMDGS01',
 IF lv_cr_process = 'SUP1'.
  lt_supp_data = VALUE #( lt_cr_data[ usmd_entity = 'BP_HEADER' usmd_entity_cont = 'BP_CENTRL' struct = 'KATTR' ]-r_data  OPTIONAL ). 
   IF lt_supp_data IS BOUND .
    ASSIGN lt_supp_data->* TO <lt_supp_data>.
     IF <lt_supp_data> IS ASSIGNED.
      LOOP AT <lt_supp_data> ASSIGNING <ls_supp_data>.
       ASSIGN COMPONENT 'NAME_ORG1' OF STRUCTURE <ls_supp_data> TO <lv_fno>.
        IF <lv_fno> IS ASSIGNED AND <lv_fno> IS NOT INITIAL.
         .
         . "Requirement Logic etc...
         .
        ENDIF.
       ENDLOOP.
     ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
   ENDIF.
ENDIF.

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: Re: Cycle Count Report
entry.content:
Hi @kasandra ,

Could you please first check if Transaction LX26 or Transaction LX17 helps?
If you need further assistance with the Cycle Count report, you may contact SAP support by creating a case using the component SCM-EWM-PI, even though it is typically a consulting topic.

Best regards,
Charles

entry.title: Re: How to grey out the Delete button in VA02Ôºü
entry.content:
In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the T-code VA02 is not applicable. Use the Fiori app Manage Sales Orders and control the Delete function via IAM, UI adaptation, or a Cloud BAdI.

1, IAM (Maintain Business Roles) ‚Üí set Delete to Not Allowed for Manage Sales Orders. This approach is the clean, security-focused method.

SAP Community-Using Restrictions to Enhance User Authorizations in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition

2.Adapt UI (optional) ‚Üí hide the Delete action for a cleaner screen (cosmetic only). UI5 Demo Kit

3.Cloud BAdI (optional, enforce rules) ‚Üí Utilise the deletion-check BAdI to prevent deletions with a message (e.g., when a delivery exists).

KBA 3152093 - BADI - SD_SLS_CHECK_DELETE_ITEM - Initiated in Manage Sales Orders when removing delivery block

KBA 3468218 - Reject or delete all unconfirmed items at once in a sales order using application Mass Change of Sales Orders - S/4HANA Cloud

Recommendation

Perform step #1 for all end users; optionally, execute step #2 for UX; and proceed with step #3 if conditional business rules are needed, for example, never delete after goods issue.

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: RISE with SAP: Summary of public information available-PART1
entry.content:
Hi Raj,

Is it possible to map the content of the Current RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition
Service Description Guide to a website used by partners to create accurate offerings ? 

The goal would be that the Business Partner hosts a portal where tech sellers/marketing create a stepped offering, in this offering a field for RISE would appear and automatically contain the current content available from the SDG, then tech sellers/marketing could then select the customer requirement options and add this to the new offering plan.

entry.title: Supplier Contract for multiple Company Codes
entry.content:
Hi Team, 

One of my customers would like to see how to handle this scenario best in the S/4 Public Cloud: 

In the standard SAP system, purchase contracts can only be assigned to a single company code.
However, in the business practice of our customer, there are supplier contracts that are valid for several company codes and their
plants at the same time.

‚Ä¢ The customer creates more than 700 new purchase contracts on a monthly basis.
‚Ä¢ Each of these contracts must be duplicated for each company code.
‚Ä¢ This leads to significant additional effort, process delays, and a high risk of inconsistencies in changes.

Request:
We need the ability to consume purchase contracts across company codes for the central purchasing organization, so that plants from
multiple company codes can apply the same contract.

Added value:
‚Ä¢ Massive reduction of double maintenance effort (700+ contracts per month).
‚Ä¢ Improve data quality through centralized and consistent contract management.
‚Ä¢ Practical representation of a central purchasing organization with several company codes.

Does anyone have any input on this? 

Thanks and kind regards

Kathrin

entry.title: Certifications for Healthcare: A sense of assurance and trust
entry.content:
Ever wondered what happens behind the scenes of various apps and services offered by cloud service provider?  
Actually a lot. This covers the entire software product lifecycle of design, development, operations, delivery, maintenance, and feedback from customers and users.  

How do we trust that everything which happens behind the scenes is well executed and done, audited regularly and‚ÄØnothing is compromised at any stage?  

This is where various control measures, certifications, and audits play a critical role for‚ÄØtransparent and effective assessment. 
In this blog, I'll talk about SAP Health Data Services for FHIR.‚ÄØHow did we build assurance and trust throughout from design to active usage by our customers and partners? So, let's begin. 

Service and Organisation Controls (SOC) 

The Service and Organisation Controls or in short SOC certification reports are global standards. These certification reports offer a detailed understanding into the design and operational effectiveness of internal control systems implemented within cloud product.   

There are different types of SOC reports as described in the diagram after this. They also differ upon the duration on which these SOC reports are generated. ‚ÄØ 

SAP Health Data Services for FHIR is certified for both SOC 1 and SOC 2 reports. They're Type 2 reports which means controls are measured for a longer duration of time. What does this mean for you? 

For our Customers and Partners this certification is about assurance on the effectiveness of SAP controls related to financial reporting, security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy. Some of the controls and corresponding importance are highlighted in the following diagram. 

Personally, when I visit a hospital, I‚ÄØlike to have my data to be stored and processed with absolute confidentiality. Data is shared only on a need-to-know basis even within hospital staffs having proper authorization. This way I'm happy that my personal information and my sensitive data are secured and not misused.  

Now, let me take you through an attestation in the next section. 

Cloud Computing Compliance Criteria Catalogue (C5) 

The C5 (Cloud Computing Compliance Criteria Catalogue) is a comprehensive standard defined by the German Federal Office for Information Security (BSI). The C5 is attestation for truthfulness and authenticity about the security compliance from the cloud service provider. 

The C5 attestation is an independent and external audit which covers broad range of security aspects including governance, risk management, and technical controls. The C5 attestation also comes in two types which covers scope of the auditor‚Äôs report: 

It confirms that SAP Health Data Services for FHIR has undergone a rigorous audit, proving its strong security controls and operational transparency. The C5 audit report is of Type 2. 

For our Customers and Partners, this means a cloud service offers strong security measures and high operational efficiency. Some of the controls and corresponding importance are highlighted in the following diagram.  

The list is exhaustive. I'm listing down key controls which you can relate easily and are always on our mind. 

When I visit a hospital, I prefer not to hear ‚ÄúSystem is down‚Äù, which means billing can't be done or prescription can't be generated. The‚ÄØC5 attestation and audit helps to avoid these situations so that it doesn't happen with the cloud services used in hospital. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

International Organisation for Standardisation (ISO/IEC ‚Äì 27000 family of standards) 

ISO standards are external certifications offered in accordance with ISO guidelines and are independent of any industry. It's a set of standards used globally by organisations of all sizes and sectors to ensure compliance, safeguard sensitive data and improve trust with stakeholders.  

The standard mainly talks about the Information Security Management System (ISMS), its adoption and effective implementation by an Organisation, in the context of this blog, its cloud service provider. ISMS preserves the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information by applying a risk management process and gives confidence to interested parties that risks are adequately managed. 

Some of the important measures and controls of the standard along with corresponding importance are listed in the following diagram. As you see, most of them apply to any industry and applicable to any product and services. 

 

SAP Health Data Services for FHIR in its product lifecycle is developed with the right set of roles and responsibilities defined. With awareness to the process, understanding of the risks involved and adherence to the performance evaluation.  

For our Customers and Partners, ISO standards‚ÄØmean that adequate due diligence and effective practices are followed for the service. 

Final words 

In healthcare industry where we deal with personal and sensitive data in highly regulated environment,‚ÄØit is of great significance to understand how well these apps and services are developed, maintained, and operated. 

Certification and attestation for the product and services ensures this for SAP Health Data Services for FHIR. When you use this service, you're consuming the assurance and trust which comes along with it.  

For more details about the certifications and attestations of SAP Health Data Services for FHIR visit the SAP Discovery Center page. For viewing compliance report, visit SAP Compliance Finder.  

Looking forward for further engagement on this topic, I welcome your ideas and comments.

entry.title: Re: Raise RAP Events in non-RAP Applications
entry.content:
Hi,

Thanks for the details. I followed the steps and able to trigger the event successfully, but facing one issue though. The event is in 'To be sent' status and not sent to SAP Event mesh. There are no error in channel and connection test is successful. In fact, when other standard events are triggered in this channel, they are sent and along with them, this event in To be sent is also sent, but not automatically.

Is any config required to send/publish these events automatically without holding them in 'To be Sent' status?

entry.title: Re: Action button is not visible in the my inbox
entry.content: It's application dependent. It could be by customizing, by authorization, etc. What workflow ID is it? (transaction SBWP, SWI1, it should be an ID like WS99999999). If it's based on authorizations, it can be traced (STAUTHTRACE, SU53).

entry.title: Service consumption model (SRVC) - RFC - How to regnerate or edit a generated model?
entry.content:
Hi,

we are developing on a S4 2023 FPS3 on Prem System. I am using a  service consumption model (SRVC) for calling a RFC function call in an other ABAP System. See SAP Help

Because the called function is also still in development I want to regenerate the consumption model in eclipse but it seems not possible. The SAP Help also has only the one time creation descriped: Link

Has someone more information about that topic? 

Bye Bye Richard

entry.title: Re: Performance Issue in 'ME_INFORECORD_MAINTAIN'
entry.content:
There are some OSS notes (e.g. 2787315 - Issues when using ME_INFORECORD_MAINTAIN - ERP and S/4HANA) that suggest other tools

  • ME_INFORECORD_MAINTAIN_MULTI
  • Idoc type INFREC
  • program RM06IBI0

entry.title: Re: SAP Security
entry.content:
Hi,

Your question for "a server" should be in a context of what kind of server you're expecting. Typically all kind of Service Requests are done via SAP4Me in order to ensure proper assignments of instances to customers, as described in Note 3239384.

Please follow the guidelines as described.

Best regards
